topics.body:
Are indie games and normal games placed in different categories for reviews and criticism?
Because if it isn't, it should.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557631c863687216bb0004ef#post_557631c863687216bb0004ef
well i mean all it really needs is interesting weapons/armour, a large area to fuck around and explore in, and ofc be able to do things multiple ways

as for mods it really depends on how bad the coders/modders want things to be in a game i guess, just because theres a new edition doesnt mean that the mods will spring up right away

that wasnt too true for gta v though, so idk
topics.author: 50a843d47f123b2e7c001359

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5576342a6368727d6c000961#post_5576342a6368727d6c000961
why
topics.author: 50a843d47f123b2e7c001359

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5576342a6368727d6c000961#post_5576342a6368727d6c000961
[bq="HJSDGCE"]Are indie games and normal games placed in different categories for reviews and criticism?
Because if it isn't, it should.[/bq]
No. They shouldn't. A game is a game regardless of it's budget. Remember, criticism is meant to be as objective as humanly possible, The moment you start making exceptions in a critique based on a minor aspect of something you have UTTERLY failed as a critic.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55763507636872199400161e#post_55763507636872199400161e
The very core mechanic. I noticed that indie games are different due to the freedom that indie developers have. So, the quality of the games depends on the kind of game it is made. Most indie games these days are usually to express artistic value so the style and gameplay doesn't follow the usual mechanic used by various games supported by producers. Due to that, indie games shouldn't be comparable to those games since it's too different.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557635ed6368724752000f40#post_557635ed6368724752000f40
No. I said it earlier. A game is a game. Making exceptions to criticism based solely upon whether or not something is "indie" or not misses the entire point of criticism. People DON'T CARE about a game's budget. They DON'T CARE about a game's dev process. They only care if it's good. Because a critic does serve the creator. A critic serves the audience.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5576342a6368727d6c000961#post_5576342a6368727d6c000961
Nah
Indie developers can create games just as good if not better than larger companies. For example, proxy blade zero was made by one dude (I think) and it still has superior combat to a lot of big publisher games. 

Plus, strictly speaking valve and cd project red are indie developers and they don't need help with nothin'
